page.title: 15Music, Crafts and Dance
page.content: In Sanquhar there is neither a cinema nor a theatre, but there is a long tradition of music in the town. There is a musical society which competes in the annual Dumfries Music Festival as do our youth organisations, school choirs and young musicians from the school orchestra, the silver band and a nearby pipe band. Young people have formed two "pop" groups and a dance band. A violin maker of international repute resides in Sanquhar. A dance school teaching ballet, Highland and tap dancing is held weekly and a Scottish Country Dance class is held regularly 4 miles NW of town. Old crafts such as Crook-making, spinning and weaving and hand knitting of the traditional "Sanquhar" patterns still survive. Examples of all these crafts are displayed in our museum, which has just celebrated its tenth anniversary.
